subject: Re: [junit] singletons and running tests more than once
msgSnippet: ... BINGO! Whoever uses the properties should not care where the properties come from. Your production environment grabs the properties from System; your tests
messageBody:
>f) Make the singleton non-exclusive, i.e. have a public constructor in
>that class for users that want their own instance, like the testcase.
>But that would mean that the testcase doesn't test the singleton aspect
>of the class.

BINGO!

Whoever uses the properties should not care where the properties come from. Your production environment grabs the properties from System; your tests just create them as needed.

Take care.
